duties_responsibilities.duty: Initiate activities, procedures, and projects to improve product quality, optimize production capacity, ensure equipment reliability, provide capital improvements, integrate new technology and practices, and optimize overall performance.
Manage/lead projects, work on-site at the Pampa Development and Manufacturing Center, and pilot plant in Pampa, TX.

Plan, organize, and lead commercial production and research operations, and provide leadership and expertise regarding continuous improvements in manufacturing process capability, capacity, and productivity.

Develop and implement process changes and equipment care procedures to ensure plant safety and reliability, focusing on specific products/line/units, plant process/equipment Reliability, and/or Process Safety Management.
Recommend and implement changes to improve plant performance, optimize product volume, yields and quality, and minimize operating costs while maximizing unit safety and reliability.
Lead new product and process development teams, oversee development of plant wide Standard Operating Procedures, and provide leadership and technical expertise to solve complex operating problems.

Conduct “end-of-life” assessments, assist with equipment repairs, provide information and guidance to original equipment manufacturers, and ensure compliance with all standards, regulations, and industry best practices.
Communicate with regional and corporate counterparts to facilitate continuous improvement and ongoing organizational learning.

education_certification.credential: Post-secondary Chemical or Mechanical Engineering degree (Bachelor’s/University) and generally 5+ years’ experience and 3 years of production experience in a demanding specialty chemical industry, with carbon black production experience preferred. Familiarity with topics such as Process Safety Management (PSM), safe work permitting, lockout/tagout, emergency response, and hazard recognition.
